item.title: RE:Quick fix with drops (Scroll all the way down)
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“Pblord7, post:11, topic:364945”][quote author=Junes link=topic=461146.msg3373634#msg3373634 date=1287432997]
put your code back in (use this one) i’ve edited it so that it should compile correctly but you shouldnt lose items on the ground

if (playerRights == 0) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
return ;
}

if that doesnt work try

if (playerRights == 3) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
return ;
}

this means that your owner/co-owner cant drop items after using pickup so no one can get rares from them etc to bypass your trade log
[/quote]

Or…
Search this is Client.java

public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {

Then add this under it:

if(playerRights == 4) { sM("Hiddens are forbidden to drop items"); return; } if(playerRights == 3) { sM("Staff are forbidden to drop items"); return; } if(playerRights == 2) { sM("Admins are forbidden to drop items"); return; } [/quote]
well after i did that one the compler is still 100 errors but it looks like this now

client.java:9969: class, interface, or enum expected if(playerRights == 4) { ^ client.java:9971: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:9972: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9975: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:9976: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9979: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:9980: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9984: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9987: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9990: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9993: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9996: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:9999: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10002: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10005: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10008: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10011: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10014: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10017: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10020: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10023: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10026: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10029: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10032: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10035: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10038: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10041: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10044: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10047: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10050: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10053: class, interface, or enum expected dealDamage(15); ^ client.java:10054: class, interface, or enum expected hitDiff = 15; ^ client.java:10055: class, interface, or enum expected plrText = "Ouch!"; ^ client.java:10056: class, interface, or enum expected plrTextUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10057: class, interface, or enum expected updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10058: class, interface, or enum expected hitUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10059: class, interface, or enum expected setAnimation(827); ^ client.java:10060: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:10061: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10068: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(14171); ^ client.java:10069: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte( 0); ^ client.java:10070: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(droppedItem + 1); ^ client.java:10071: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(255); ^ client.java:10072: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeDWord(1); ^ client.java:10073: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); ^ client.java:10074: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126("Are you sure you want to destroy this object?", 14174) ; ^ client.java:10075: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126("Yes.", 14175); ^ client.java:10076: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126("No.", 141756); ^ client.java:10077: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126(""+GetItemName(droppedItem), 14184); ^ client.java:10078: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126(getMessageA(droppedItem),14182); ^ client.java:10079: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame126(getMessageB(droppedItem),14183); ^ client.java:10080: class, interface, or enum expected sendFrame164(14170); ^ client.java:10081: class, interface, or enum expected publicDroppendItem = droppedItem; ^ client.java:10082: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:10083: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10087: class, interface, or enum expected deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]); ^ client.java:10088: class, interface, or enum expected updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10089: class, interface, or enum expected savegame(false); ^ client.java:10090: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10097: class, interface, or enum expected in.read(inStream.buffer, 0, forceRead); ^ client.java:10099: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10101: class, interface, or enum expected public int findItem(int id, int[] items, int[] amounts) { ^ client.java:10102: class, interface, or enum expected for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { ^ client.java:10102: class, interface, or enum expected for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { ^ client.java:10105: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10108: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10111: class, interface, or enum expected public void fish(int id) { ^ client.java:10114: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10117: class, interface, or enum expected } else { ^ client.java:10119: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10121: class, interface, or enum expected int exp = 0, required = -1; ^ client.java:10122: class, interface, or enum expected switch (id) { ^ client.java:10126: class, interface, or enum expected exp = 250; ^ client.java:10127: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10129: class, interface, or enum expected case 377: ^ client.java:10132: class, interface, or enum expected exp = 400; ^ client.java:10133: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10135: class, interface, or enum expected case 383: ^ client.java:10138: class, interface, or enum expected exp = 1000; ^ client.java:10139: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10141: class, interface, or enum expected case 389: ^ client.java:10144: class, interface, or enum expected exp = 1500; ^ client.java:10145: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10147: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10151: class, interface, or enum expected addItem(id, 1); ^ client.java:10152: class, interface, or enum expected addSkillXP(exp, playerFishing); ^ client.java:10153: class, interface, or enum expected } else { ^ client.java:10155: class, interface, or enum expected resetAction(true); ^ client.java:10156: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10159: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10162: class, interface, or enum expected public void fletchBow() { ^ client.java:10165: class, interface, or enum expected return; ^ client.java:10166: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10168: class, interface, or enum expected closeInterface(); ^ client.java:10169: class, interface, or enum expected IsBanking = false; ^ client.java:10170: class, interface, or enum expected pEmote = 885; ^ client.java:10171: class, interface, or enum expected updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10172: class, interface, or enum expected appearanceUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10173: class, interface, or enum expected if (playerHasItem(logs[fletchLog])) { ^ 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .
plus now since im so pissed off i mine as well deleate the whole soruce and re download and start all over ever tho i put few weeks of work into this..

item.title: RE:Quick fix with drops (Scroll all the way down)
item.dc:creator: @Pblord7 Pblord7
item.description:
@Pblord7 wrote:

[quote=“Junes, post:10, topic:364945”]put your code back in (use this one) i’ve edited it so that it should compile correctly but you shouldnt lose items on the ground

if (playerRights == 0) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
return ;
}

if that doesnt work try

if (playerRights == 3) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
return ;
}

this means that your owner/co-owner cant drop items after using pickup so no one can get rares from them etc to bypass your trade log[/quote]

Or…
Search this is Client.java

public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) {

Then add this under it:

if(playerRights == 4) {
        sM("Hiddens are forbidden to drop items");
        return;
}
		if(playerRights == 3) {
        sM("Staff are forbidden to drop items");
        return;
}
		if(playerRights == 2) {
        sM("Admins are forbidden to drop items");
        return;
}

item.title: RE:Quick fix with drops (Scroll all the way down)
item.dc:creator: @Junes Junes
item.description:
@Junes wrote:

put your code back in (use this one) i’ve edited it so that it should compile correctly but you shouldnt lose items on the ground

if (playerRights == 0) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
return ;
}

if that doesnt work try

if (playerRights == 3) {
sM(
"You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem)
+ “, it vanishes into the ground.”);
deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]);
return ;
}

this means that your owner/co-owner cant drop items after using pickup so no one can get rares from them etc to bypass your trade log

let me know if this fixes your problem

Read full topic

item.title: RE:Quick fix with drops (Scroll all the way down)
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

I just want to fix the droping system, when I drop an item it disappears on the ground, I want the drops to stay on the ground,
I’m pretty sure I know how to fix this I just wana be 100% sure

if (playerRights == 0) { sM( "You drop the " + getItemName(droppedItem) + ", it vanishes into the ground."); deleteItem(droppedItem, slot, playerItemsN[slot]); return ; }
would I just delete that whole thing to fix the drops?

Read full topic
item.source: RE:Quick fix with drops (Scroll all the way down)
